intro: Gynochthodes hupehensis, commonly known as the Hupeh bellflower, is a species of flowering plant in the Campanulaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
